org.magnos.asset.io
Class CharacterReader

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.asset.io.CharacterReader

public class CharacterReader
extends Object

A simple parser for reading characters. The parser keeps track of character index, line number, and column index.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Parameters:

Method Detail

parseCharacter

public char parseCharacter(boolean escapable,
                           boolean rejectControlCharacters,
                           boolean acceptUnicode)
                    throws IOException
Parses a single character from the current character (data). If escapable is true and the current character is an escape character, then possible values will be determined. If the next character is a control character and control characters are not allowed an IOException is thrown. If the next character is a marker for a control character, the actual control character is returned. If the next character is a marker for unicode then the next 4 hex characters are read to determine the unicode value.

Parameters:
escapable - If escapable characters are permitted to be read.
rejectControlCharacters - If control characters following an escape are allowed.
acceptUnicode - If unicode is acceptable after an escape.
Returns:
The character parsed.
Throws:
IOException - An error occurred reading from the reader.

readHexDigit

public int readHexDigit()
                 throws IOException
Reads a hex digit from the next character in the reader.

Returns:
The hex value, between 0 and 15 inclusive.
Throws:
IOException - An error occurred reading the next error.

readHexDigitIndexed

public int readHexDigitIndexed(int index)
                        throws IOException
Reads a hex digit from the next character in the reader.

Parameters:
index - The index of the hex digit in a unicode character. This is used to create a more useful exception message.
Returns:
The hex value, between 0 and 15 inclusive.
Throws:
IOException - An error occurred reading the next character.

readUntil

public String readUntil(CharacterSet stop,
                        boolean includeCurrent,
                        boolean readAsCharacter,
                        boolean backup)
                 throws IOException
Reads and returns a string until any one of the characters in a set is reached.

Parameters:
stop - The set to use to determine when to stop.
includeCurrent - If the current character should be included in the output.
readAsCharacter - If parseCharacter(boolean, boolean, boolean) should be used to build characters in the string, if not the raw character value is appended to the output.
backup - If the reader should back up one character so the next character in the reader is the character that it stopped on.
Returns:
The string read from the current character to a stopping character.
Throws:
IOException - An error occurred reading the next character.

readPastWhitespace

public int readPastWhitespace()
                       throws IOException
Reads past all whitespace. This will return the next character in the reader which is not whitespace.

Returns:
The non-whitespace character read or -1 if end of reader.
Throws:
IOException - An error occurred reading the next character.

readData

public int readData()
             throws IOException
Reads the next character.

Returns:
The next character.
Throws:
IOException - An error occurred reading the next character.

unreadData

public void unreadData()
Un-reads the last character read.

getCursor

public String getCursor()
Returns:
A description of the reader consisting of the index of the current character, it's line, and it's column.

hex

public static int hex(int x)
Converts the character to a hex value. If the character is not a valid hex digit then NO_DATA is returned, otherwise a number between 0 and 15 inclusive.

Parameters:
x - The character to calculate a hex value from.
Returns:
The hex value.
